item.title: Data Source Identifier
item.definition: Identification of the system sending the data.
item.remark: Note: - The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the EUROCONTROL Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int/asterix).

item.title: Service Identification
item.definition: Identification of the service provided to one or more users.

item.title: Track Number
item.definition: Identification of a track.

item.title: Track Mode 3/A Code
item.definition: Mode-3/A code converted into octal representation.

item.title: Time Of Track Information
item.definition: Absolute time stamping of the information provided in the track message, in the form of elapsed time since last mid night, expressed as UTC.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. This is the time of the track state vector. 2. The time is reset to zero at every midnight.

item.title: Track Status

content.value: SPI present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data

item.name: SRC
item.title: Source of Calculated Track Altitude for I062/130

content.value: Last message transmitted to the user for the track
First message transmitted to the user for the track
ADS-B data inconsistent with other surveillance information
Track not resulting from amalgamation process
Military Emergency present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data
Military Identification present in the last report received from a sensor capable of decoding this data
Age of the last received track update is higher than system dependent threshold (coasting)
Age of the last received PSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received SSR track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received Mode S track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Age of the last received ADS-B track update is higher than system dependent threshold
Special Used Code (Mode A codes to be defined in the system to mark a track with special interest)
Assigned Mode A Code Conflict (same discrete Mode A Code assigned to another track)
Track created / updated with FPL data
Duplicate Flight Plan due to manual correlation

item.definition: Status of a track.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Track type and coasting can also be derived from I062/290 System Track Update Ages 2. If the system supports the technology, default value (0) means that the technology was used to produce the report 3. If the system does not support the technology, default value is meaningless. 4. Bits (EMS): other than subfield #11 of data item I062/380, these bits allow the SDPS to set the emergency indication as derived from other sources than ADS-B (e.g. based on the Mode 3/A code). 5. Bit 3 (PFT): with this flag an SDPS can indicate that internal processing points to the track being potentially false. Details on the internal processing are system dependent. In order to improve security on targets provided by ADS-B numerous validation functions have been developed in the ADS-B ground domain. If any of these validation functions show a potentially spoofed target, the PFT bit will be used to convey this information to the CWP. If and how this information is processed and displayed on the CWP is a local matter and not subject to the category 062 specification. 6. Bit (FPLT): this bit - if set - indicates that the information contained in the target report has been updated by flight plan related data because no surveillance data was available for the target, or was created based on flight plan related data in areas with no surveillance. 7. Bit (DUPT) is set to 1 if the correlation between the target report and a flight plan is not possible because the Mode 3/A code stated in the flight plan exists more than once in the surveillance data. 8. Bit (DUPF) - if set to 1 - indicates that for a specific surveillance target more than one flight plan exists which makes correlation impossible. 9. Bit (DUPM) is set to 1 if a target was correlated manually but also a regular flight plan exists. 10. All tracks for which bits 8, 7 or 6 are set to 1 are marked on the CWP. 11. Bit 5 (SFC) is set to 1 when the SDPS considers the target to be on the Surface (the actual meaning is implementation dependent – please refer to chapter 4.8 above). 12. Bit 4 (IDD) is set to 1 when the Flight ID is present more than once in the surveillance area. 13. Bit 3 (IEC) is set to 1 when the comparison between various sources has revealed an inconsistency in the information contained about emergency codes. 14. If I062/080 (MRH) indicates "Barometric altitude (Mode C) more reliable", and a calculated altitude is transmitted, it shall be transmitted using data item I062/135 “Calculated Track Barometric Altitude”. 15. If I062/080 (MRH) indicates "Geometric altitude more reliable", and a calculated altitude is transmitted, it shall be transmitted using data item I062/130 “Calculated Track Geometric Altitude”. In this case the source for I062/130 is indicated by I062/080 (SRC). 16. Data Items I062/130, I062/135, and I062/136 may be transmitted in parallel whenever the respective information is available. This is independent from the value transmitted on I062/080 (MRH).

item.title: Calculated Track Position
item.definition: Calculated position in Cartesian co-ordinates with a resolution of 0.5m, in two's complement form.

item.title: Calculated Position In WGS-84 Co-ordinates
item.definition: Calculated Position in WGS-84 Co-ordinates with a resolution of :math:`180/2^{25}` degrees.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The LSB provides a resolution at least better than 0.6m.

item.title: Mode 5 Data Reports and Extended Mode 1 Code

content.value: No authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report
Authenticated Mode 5 Data reply or Report (i.e any valid Mode 5 reply type other than ID)
Mode 1 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode 2 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode 3 code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C altitude code not present or not from Mode 5 reply
Mode C altitude from Mode 5 reply

item.name: X
item.title: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data Reply or Report

content.value: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received

item.name: RES
item.title: Resolution with which the GNSS-derived Altitude (GA) is Reported

item.name: GA
item.title: GNSS-derived Altitude of Target, Expressed as Height Above WGS 84 Ellipsoid

item.name: EM1
item.title: Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation

item.name: EM1
item.title: Extended Mode 1 Reply in Octal Representation

item.name: TOS
item.title: Time Offset for POS and GA
item.description: Time Offset coded as a twos complement number with an LSB of 1/128 s. The time at which the Mode 5 Reported Position (Subfield #3) and Mode 5 GNSS-derived Altitude (Subfield #4) are valid is given by Time of Day (I048/140) plus Time Offset.

item.name: X5
item.title: X-pulse from Mode 5 Data Reply or Report

content.value: X-pulse set to zero or no authenticated Data reply or Report received
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode C reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 3/A reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 2 reply
X-pulse set to zero or no Mode 1 reply

item.definition: Mode 5 Data reports and Extended Mode 1 Code.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The flags M2, M3, MC refer to the contents of data subitems I062/120, I062/060 and I062/135 respectively. The flag M1 refers to the contents of the Subfield #5 (Extended Mode 1 Code in Octal Representation). 2. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Emergency bit set, then the Military Emergency bit (ME) in Data Item I062/080, Track Status, shall be set. 3. If an authenticated Mode 5 reply is received with the Identification of Position bit set, then the Special Position Identification bit (SPI) in Data Item I062/080, Track Status, shall be set. 4. The resolution implied by the LSB is better than the resolution with which Mode 5 position reports are transmitted from aircraft transponders using currently defined formats. 5. GA is coded as a 14-bit two's complement binary number with an LSB of 25 ft. irrespective of the setting of RES. 6. The minimum value of GA that can be reported is -1000 ft. 7. If Subfield #1 is present, the M1 bit in Subfield #1 indicates whether the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 5 reply or a Mode 1 reply. If Subfield #1 is not present, the Extended Mode 1 Code is from a Mode 1 reply. 8. TOS shall be assumed to be zero if Subfield #6 is not present.

item.title: Track Mode 2 Code
item.definition: Mode 2 code associated to the track

item.title: Calculated Track Geometric Altitude
item.definition: Vertical distance between the target and the projection of its position on the earth's ellipsoid, as defined by WGS84, in two's complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. LSB is required to be less than 10 ft by ICAO 2. The source of altitude is identified in bits (SRC) of item I062/080 Track Status.

item.title: Calculated Track Barometric Altitude
item.definition: Calculated barometric altitude of the track, in two's complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
1) ICAO specifies a range between -10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C

item.title: Measured Flight Level
item.definition: Last valid and credible flight level used to update the track, in two's complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The criteria to determine the credibility of the flight level are Tracker dependent. 2. Credible means: within reasonable range of change with respect to the previous detection. 3. ICAO specifies a range between -10 FL and 1267 FL for Mode C. 4. This item includes the barometric altitude received from ADS-B.

item.title: Calculated Track Velocity (Cartesian)
item.definition: Calculated track velocity expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates,in two's complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the target.

item.title: Mode of Movement
item.definition: Calculated Mode of Movement of a target.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The ADF, if set, indicates that a difference has been detected in the altitude information derived from radar as compared to other technologies (such as ADS-B).

item.title: Calculated Acceleration (Cartesian)
item.definition: Calculated Acceleration of the target expressed in Cartesian co-ordinates, in two's complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The y-axis points to the Geographical North at the location of the target. 2. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

item.title: Calculated Rate of Climb/Descent
item.definition: Calculated rate of climb/descent of an aircraft in two's complement form.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. A positive value indicates a climb, whereas a negative value indicates a descent.

item.title: Target Identification

content.value: Callsign or registration downlinked from target

item.name: CHR
item.title: Characters 1-8 (Coded on 6 Bits Each) Defining Target Identification

item.definition: Target (aircraft or vehicle) identification in 8 characters.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. For coding, see section 3.1.2.9 of [Ref.3] 2. As the Callsign of the target can already be transmitted (thanks to I062/380 Subfield #2 if downlinked from the aircraft or thanks to I062/390 Subfield #2 if the target is correlated to a flight plan), and in order to avoid confusion at end user's side, this item SHALL not be used.

item.title: Target Size and Orientation

item.name: LENGTH
item.title: Length
item.description: Length

item.name: ORIENTATION
item.title: Orientation
item.description: Length

item.name: WIDTH
item.title: Width
item.description: Length

item.definition: Target size defined as length and width of the detected target, and orientation.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The orientation gives the direction which the target nose is pointing to,relative to the Geographical North. 2. When the length only is sent, the largest dimension is provided.

item.title: System Track Update Ages

item.name: TRK
item.title: Track Age
item.description: Actual track age since occurence

item.name: PSR
item.title: PSR Age
item.description: Age of the last primary detection used to update the track

item.name: SSR
item.title: SSR Age
item.description: Age of the last secondary detection used to update the track

item.name: MDS
item.title: Mode S Age
item.description: Age of the last Mode S detection used to update the track

item.name: ADS
item.title: ADS-C Age
item.description: Age of the last ADS-C report used to update the track

item.name: ES
item.title: ADS-B Extended Squitter Age
item.description: Age of the last 1090 Extended Squitter ADS-B report used to update the track

item.name: VDL
item.title: ADS-B VDL Mode 4 Age
item.description: Age of the last VDL Mode 4 ADS-B report used to update the track

item.name: UAT
item.title: ADS-B UAT Age
item.description: Age of the last UAT ADS-B report used to update the track

item.name: LOP
item.title: Loop Age
item.description: Age of the last magnetic loop detection

item.name: MLT
item.title: Multilateration Age
item.description: Age of the last MLT detection

item.definition: Ages of the last plot/local track/target report update for each sensor type.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Except for Track Age, the ages are counted from Data Item I062/070, Time Of Track Information, using the following formula: Age = Time of track information - Time of last detection used to update the track 2. The time of last detection is derived from monosensor category time of day 3. If the data has never been received, then the corresponding subfield is not sent. 4. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

item.title: Track Data Ages

item.name: MFL
item.title: Measured Flight Level Age
item.description: Age of the last valid and credible Mode C code or barometric altitude from ADS-B used to update the track (I062/136).

item.name: MD1
item.title: Mode 1 Age
item.description: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 1 code used to update the track (I062/110).

item.name: MD2
item.title: Mode 2 Age
item.description: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 2 code used to update the track (I062/120).

item.name: MDA
item.title: Mode 3/A Age
item.description: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 3/A code used to update the track (I062/060).

item.name: MD4
item.title: Mode 4 Age
item.description: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 4 code used to update the track.

item.name: MD5
item.title: Mode 5 Age
item.description: Age of the last valid and credible Mode 5 code used to update the track (I062/110).

item.name: MHG
item.title: Magnetic Heading Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Magnetic Heading" in item 062/380 (Subfield #3).

item.name: IAS
item.title: Indicated Airspeed / Mach Nb Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Indicated Airspeed/Mach Number" in item 062/380 (Subfield #4).

item.name: TAS
item.title: True Airspeed Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "True Airspeed" in item 062/380 (Subfield #5).

item.name: SAL
item.title: Selected Altitude Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Selected Altitude" in item 062/380 (Subfield #6).

item.name: FSS
item.title: Final State Selected Altitude Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Final State Selected Altitude Age" in item 062/380 (Subfield #7).

item.name: TID
item.title: Trajectory Intent Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Trajectory Intent" in item 062/380 (Subfield #8).

item.name: COM
item.title: Communication/ACAS Capability and Flight Status Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Communication/ACAS Capability and Flight Status" in item 062/380 (Subfield #10).

item.name: SAB
item.title: Status Reported by ADS-B Age

item.name: ACS
item.title: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report Age

item.name: BVR
item.title: Barometric Vertical Rate Age

item.name: GVR
item.title: Geometrical Vertical Rate Age

item.name: RAN
item.title: Roll Angle Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Roll Angle" in item 062/380 (Subfield #15).

item.name: TAR
item.title: Track Angle Rate Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Track Angle Rate" in item 062/380 (Subfield #16).

item.name: TAN
item.title: Track Angle Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Track Angle" in item 062/380 (Subfield #17).

item.name: GSP
item.title: Ground Speed Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Ground Speed" in item 062/380 (Subfield #18).

item.name: VUN
item.title: Velocity Uncertainty Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Velocity Uncertainty" in item 062/380 (Subfield #19).

item.name: MET
item.title: Meteorological Data Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Meteorological Data" in item 062/380 (Subfield #20).

item.name: EMC
item.title: Emitter Category Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Emitter Category" in item 062/380 (Subfield #21).

item.name: POS
item.title: Position Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Position" in item 062/380 (Subfield #23).

item.name: GAL
item.title: Geometric Altitude Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Geometric Altitude" in item 062/380 (Subfield #24).

item.name: PUN
item.title: Position Uncertainty Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Position Uncertainty" in item 062/380 (Subfield #25).

item.name: MB
item.title: Mode S MB Data Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Mode S MB Data" in item 062/380 (Subfield #22).

item.name: IAR
item.title: Indicated Airspeed Data Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Indicated Airspeed" in item 062/380 (Subfield #26).

item.name: MAC
item.title: Mach Number Data Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Mach Number" in item 062/380 (Subfield #27).

item.name: BPS
item.title: Barometric Pressure Setting Data Age
item.description: Age of the DAP "Barometric Pressure Setting" in item 062/380 (Subfield #28).

item.definition: Ages of the data provided.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Despite there are now two subfields (#29 and #30) reporting the ages of, respectively, the Indicated Airspeed track data and the Mach Number track data, the subfield #8 (and so its presence bit , bit-32) is kept free in order to prevent a full incompatibility with previous releases of ASTERIX Cat. 062 already implemented. 2. In all the subfields, the age is the time delay since the value was measured

item.title: Vehicle Fleet Identification
item.definition: Vehicle fleet identification number.

item.title: Measured Information

item.name: LMC
item.title: Last Measured Mode C Code
item.description: Last Measured Mode C Code, in two's complement form

content.value: Mode 3/A code as derived from the reply of the transponder
Mode 3/A code as provided by a sensor local tracker

item.definition: All measured data related to the last report used to update the track. These data are not used for ADS-B.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. In case of a plot, the measured bias-corrected polar co-ordinates; 2. In case of a sensor local track, the measured bias-corrected polar co-ordinates of the plot associated to the track; 3. In case of a local track without detection, the extrapolated bias-corrected polar co-ordinates. 4. Smoothed MODE 3/A data (L = 1) will be used in case of absence of MODE 3/A code information in the plot or in case of difference between plot and sensor local track MODE 3/A code information.

item.title: Aircraft Derived Data

item.name: ID
item.title: Target Identification
item.description: Characters 1-8 (coded on 6 bits each) defining a target identification when flight plan is available or the registration marking when no flight plan is available. Coding rules are provided in [3] Section 3.1.2.9.1.2 and Table 3-9"

item.name: MV
item.title: Manage Vertical Mode
item.description: Manage Vertical Mode

item.name: AH
item.title: Altitude Hold
item.description: Altitude Hold

item.name: AM
item.title: Approach Mode
item.description: Approach Mode

content.value: Trajectory intent data is available for this aircraft
Trajectory intent data is not available for this aircraft
Trajectory intent data is not valid

item.name: TCPN
item.title: Trajectory Change Point Number
item.description: Trajectory change point number

item.name: LAT
item.title: Latitude in WGS.84 in Two's Complement

item.name: LON
item.title: Longitude in WGS.84 in Two's Complement

item.name: TRA
item.title: Turn Radius Availability
item.description: Turn Radius Availability

content.value: Comm. A and Comm. B capability
Comm. A, Comm. B and Uplink ELM
Comm. A, Comm. B, Uplink ELM and Downlink ELM
No alert, no SPI, aircraft airborne
No alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, no SPI, aircraft on ground
Alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
No alert, SPI, aircraft airborne or on ground
Transponder ground bit not set or unknown

item.name: ACS
item.title: ACAS Resolution Advisory Report
item.description: Currently active Resolution Advisory (RA), if any, generated by the ACAS associated with the transponder transmitting the report and threat identity data. (MB Data) 56-bit message conveying Mode S Comm B message data of BDS Register 3,0

item.name: BVR
item.title: Barometric Vertical Rate
item.description: Barometric Vertical Rate in two's complement form

item.name: GVR
item.title: Geometric Vertical Rate
item.description: Geometric Vertical Rate in two's complement form

item.name: RAN
item.title: Roll Angle
item.description: Roll Angle in two's complement form

item.name: ROT
item.title: Rate of Turn in Two's Complement Form

item.name: GS
item.title: Ground Speed
item.description: Ground Speed in Two's Complement Form Referenced to WGS84

content.value: Highly manoeuvrable (5g acceleration capability) and high speed (>400 knots cruise)

item.name: POS
item.title: Position

item.name: LAT
item.title: Latitude in WGS.84 in Two's Complement Form

item.name: LON
item.title: Longitude in WGS.84 in Two's Complement Form

item.remark: This corresponds to a resolution of at least 2.4 meters.

item.name: BPS
item.title: Barometric Pressure Setting (derived from Mode S BDS 4,0)

item.definition: Data derived directly by the aircraft.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. NC is set to one when the aircraft will not fly the path described by the TCP data. 2. TCP numbers start from zero. 3. LT = Lateral Type 4. VT = Vertical Type 5. TOV gives the estimated time before reaching the point. It is defined as the absolute time from midnight. 6. TOV is meaningful only if TOA is set to 0 7. Refer to ICAO Draft SARPs for ACAS for detailed explanations. 8. A positive value represents a right turn, whereas a negative value represents a left turn. 9. Value 15 means 15 degrees/s or above. 10. Velocity uncertainty category of the least accurate velocity component 11. Positive longitude indicates East. Positive latitude indicates North. 12. LSB is required to be thinner than 10 ft by ICAO 13. Only DAPs that can not be encoded into other subfields of this item should be sent using subfield #25 14. BPS is the barometric pressure setting of the aircraft minus 800 mb.

item.title: Flight Plan Related Data
item.definition: All flight plan related information, provided by ground-based systems.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. The up-to-date list of SACs is published on the Eurocontrol Web Site (http://www.eurocontrol.int). 2. Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. TheCallsign is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any)are padded with space characters. 3. Each one of the four Octets composing the type of an aircraft contains an ASCII Character (upper-case alphanumeric characters with trailing spaces). 4. The types of aircraft are defined in [Ref.4] 5. Each one of the four Octets composing the name of an airport contains an ASCII Character (upper case alphabetic). 6. The Airport Names are indicated in the ICAO Location Indicators book. 7. Each one of the four Octets composing the name of an airport contains an ASCII Character (upper case alphabetic). 8. The Airport Names are indicated in the ICAO Location Indicators book. 9. NU1, NU2 and LTR each contain an ASCII character 10. For details refer to.[5] Section 5 11. The centre and the control position identification codes have to be defined between communication partners. 12. Estimated times are derived from flight plan systems. Predicted times are derived by the fusion system, based on surveillance data. For definitions, see [Ref.4] 13. Each one of the six Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Aircraft Stand identification is always left adjusted. It contains up to six upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters. 14. Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The SID is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters. 15. Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The STAR is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters. 16. This subfield is used only when the aircraft is transmitting an emergency Mode 3/A code 17. If VA = 0, the content of bits 12/1 is meaningless 18. Each one of the seven Octets contains an ASCII Character. The Callsign is always left adjusted. It contains up to seven upper-case alphanumeric characters, the remaining character positions (if any) are padded with space characters 19. This subfield is used only when an emergency Mode 3/A is associated with the track (I062/390 Subfield #17)

item.title: Estimated Accuracies

item.name: AGA
item.title: Estimated Accuracy Of Calculated Track Geometric Altitude

item.name: ABA
item.title: Estimated Accuracy Of Calculated Track Barometric Altitude

item.name: ARC
item.title: Estimated Accuracy Of Rate Of Climb/Descent

item.definition: Overview of all important accuracies.
item.remark:
Notes:
1. Maximum value means maximum value or above. 2. XY covariance component = sign {Cov(X,Y)} * sqrt {abs [Cov (X,Y)]} 3. The maximum value for the (unsigned) XY covariance component is 16.383 km 4. Maximum value means maximum value or above. 5. Maximum value means maximum value or above. 6. Maximum value means maximum value or above. 7. Maximum value means maximum value or above. 8. Maximum value means maximum value or above. 9. Maximum value means maximum value or above.

item.title: Track Status
item.definition: Identification of a system track.
item.remark:
Notes:
- The composed track number is used by co-operating units to uniquely identify a track. It consists of the unit identifier and system track number for each unit involved in the co-operation. The first unit identification identifies the unit that is responsible for the track amalgamation.

item.name: RE
item.title: Reserved Expansion Field
item.definition: Expansion

item.name: SP
item.title: Special Purpose Field
item.definition: Special Purpose Field
